sns.set_style(style='white')
pcts=mp_list['State'].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=True)
pcts=pd.DataFrame(pcts)
pcts.rename(columns = {'State':'All'}, inplace = True)
pct=mp_list[mp_list['Woman']==1]['State'].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=True)
pct=pd.DataFrame(pct)
pct.rename(columns = {'State':'Women'}, inplace = True)
pct=pct.merge(pcts, left_index=True, right_index=True)
pct['pct']=round(pct['Women']*100/pct['All']).astype(int)
pct['label']=pct['Women'].astype(str)+" ... out of "+pct['All'].astype(str)+" MPs"+" ... ("+pct['pct'].astype(str)+"%)" 

pct=pct[pct['pct']>79*100/461]
pct1=pct.copy()
pct1['Men']=pct1['Women']-pct1['All']
pct1['label']=-pct1['Men']
pct1.sort_values(by=['Women','label'],ascending=[True, True],inplace=True)
pct1['label']=pct1['label'].astype(str)
pct1.loc[(pct1.label == '0'),'label']=''

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6,8))
pct1[['Men','Women']].plot.barh(ax=ax,stacked=True, color=['#4b4b4b','#fd5c02'])
ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['bottom'].set_visible(False)
ax.spines['left'].set_visible(False)
ax.bar_label(ax.containers[0], pct1['label'], label_type='edge', padding=5)
ax.bar_label(ax.containers[1], label_type='edge', padding=6)
ax.margins(x=0.5)
ax.set_xticks([])
ax.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, .85), loc='upper left')


plt.title('Statewise and Genderwise number of sitting members of Loksabha, 2021*', fontsize=20, pad=15)

plt.show()

source.5359f276: Not all states are of the same size, and with the same population. Therefore the number of representatives in these states (and union territories) also vary widely. The largest 5 states are represented by more than 46% of the members.
source.c7c9f988: Only 7 states and 1 union territory have above average (>14.6%) women representatives. With 11 woman representatives in the loksabha, West Bengal has the largest number of woman members.
source.c8a68937: ~15% of the loksabha members are women.
source.2172a906: More than a third of the members are aged 50-60 years, and therefore the mean, median and mode are all in this range.

# The Great Indian Parliament - Lok Sabha This notebook introduces you to all 540 sitting members of parliament, of the seventeenth Lok sabha, India (as on 16-Jun-2021)and includes their demographics (age, gender, caste category) and constituencies (and states).
(data source: http://loksabhaph.nic.in) This code could be recycled for basic data cleaning; it also highlights some basic details about the members (e.g. average age>56 years, ~15% women, 24% SC/ST). This notebook is divided into two sections -
[1. Reading and cleaning data](#read-data)
[2. Basic Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)](#eda) Future work The plan behind collecting and sharing this data is to conduct a thorough analysis on the develepment of the Indian states vis-à-vis the demographics of their representatives in the Lok sabha.
